page.title: 07LAYER MARNEY TOWERS
page.content: Layer Marney Towers was built in 1500 by Lord Henry Marney. It took 20 years to build. Lord Henry Marney died in 1525. There are 47 rooms in the Tower.It was empty for 17 years before the Charringtons moved in. Major Charrington and his family have lived in Layer Marney Towers for 27 years. Major Charrington is a farmer, gardener, magistrate and an elected member of the church. He owns about 6 acres of gardens/pastures attached to the tower. He likes living in Layer Marney Towers because of the beautiful surroundings. He thinks it's hard work and his son will soon take over the running of things. He keeps a herd of Dexter cattle. It's open to the public on Thursdays and Sundays. One gardener is employed full-time. Major and Mrs Charrington live in part of the Towers and there are three flats for renting.
